fields.Name: Skip AssociationDB - Force-Directed Network Graph with Clustering
fields.Description: Tests Skip's ability to create D3 force-directed graph visualizations showing relationship networks with physics-based layouts and interactive drill-down to network details.

InputDefinition.userMessage: Create an interactive network graph showing connections between members based on shared activities. Each member should be a node, and draw edges between members who have participated in the same events or taken the same courses. The strength of the connection (edge thickness) should be based on the number of shared activities. Use a force-directed layout so nodes naturally cluster together based on their connections. Color-code the nodes by their primary chapter membership, and size them by their total engagement level. Make the graph interactive with zoom and pan capabilities. When I click on any member node, show me a detail card or panel displaying their profile information (name, membership type, engagement score) along with a list of their connections - show the connected members and what activities they share. Then, when I click on any connection in that list, show me a detailed table of the actual shared activities between those two members (events, courses) with dates and details. Finally, make sure I can click on any activity in that table to open the event or course record. Include tooltips when hovering over nodes to show basic member info.

judgeValidationCriteria: Response includes force-directed graph with member nodes and connection edges
Nodes colored by chapter membership with size based on engagement
Edge thickness represents number of shared activities
Graph supports zoom and pan interactions
Hover tooltips show basic member information
Clicking node shows detail panel with member profile and connections list
Connections list shows connected members and shared activity counts
Clicking connection shows table of actual shared activities
Activity table includes event/course names, dates, and types
Table rows support OpenEntityRecord for event or course records
Three levels of interaction with smooth navigation
